title: The Rise of Databases and SQL
description: A fast breakdown of The Rise of Databases and SQL for builders.

hook.text: By the 1970s, companies drowned in data stored across incompatible file formats.

buildup.text: Edgar Codd at IBM proposed the relational model â€” data organized into linked tables.

discovery.text: SQL emerged as the standard language to query tables using plain English-like commands.

twist.text: IBM nearly ignored Codd's idea. Oracle built the first commercial product and dominated.

climax.text: Today, SQL is the most widely used database language, powering apps you use every day.

punchline.text: One ignored idea now runs the web.
